text:
When you use a Xalan transformer as a SaxReader, the SAX startDocument callback 
is called two times by Xalan. U just add a test on position value in the stream 
and a reset to 0 in the endDocument. When you use a XMLReader directly, the 
outputHeader is callend oly once. May be a Xalan Bug?

I add a small diff with also some Javadoc fixing.
creator: bdhaveos@wanadoo.be
keiron@aftexsw.com
text:
I would suggest that to fix this particular problem it should be handled in the 
startDocument method of the FOTreeBuilder class, as this is the initial entry 
point of the problem and it is responsible for handling the SAX.
There can be other renderers and other situations where this will not fix the 
problem completely.

creator: pbwest@powerup.com.au
text:
Bernard,

I think the best thing would be to create a bugzilla entry with a list of the
files you have found that are broken.  I don't question your ability of motives
here, but it would, in principle, be risky for us to accept a lot of patches
that just contained line ending fixes.  For example, the patch you have
submitted for this bug also contains line ending fixes, and the detail of your
bug fix gets lost in the line ending fixes.  If you do provide a list of such
files, it will be a valuable chance for us to fix these problems, and I will
work my way through the list to do so.

I will check in line-ending changes to FOTreeBuilder, ans ask to re-submit a
patch containing only the output header fix.

Thanks.
